description: Creates a new destination that maps a device message to an AWS IoT rule.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the new resource.

parameters.name: ExpressionType
parameters.description: The type of value in Expression.

parameters.name: Expression
parameters.description: The rule name or topic rule to send messages to.

parameters.name: RoleArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the IAM Role that authorizes the destination.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to attach to the new destination. Tags are metadata that you can use to manage a resource. (dict) --- A simple label consisting of a customer-defined key-value pair The tag's key value. The tag's value.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: Each resource must have a unique client request token. The client token is used to implement idempotency. It ensures that the request completes no more than one time. If you retry a request with the same token and the same parameters, the request will complete successfully. However, if you try to create a new resource using the same token but different parameters, an HTTP 409 conflict occurs. If you omit this value, AWS SDKs will automatically generate a unique client request. For more information about idempotency, see Ensuring idempotency in Amazon EC2 API requests. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name of the new resource.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the new resource.
